unnormalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Enhanced Wildlife Protection Measures in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Environmental News Snippet: Enhanced Wildlife Protection Measures in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra Forest Department, in collaboration with the Wildlife Institute of India (WII), has announced intensified conservation efforts across several key wildlife reserves. This includes increased patrolling in the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve and Melghat Tiger Reserve, focusing particularly on curbing poaching activities.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra – The Maharashtra Forest Department, in collaboration with the Wildlife Institute of India (W I I), has announced intensified conservation efforts across several key wildlife reserves. This includes increased patrolling in the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve and Melghat Tiger Reserve, focusing particularly on curbing poaching activities.

unnormalised: New initiatives involve the deployment of advanced monitoring technology, including camera traps and drone surveillance, covering an additional 500 sq km of critical habitat. Dr. Anjali Sharma, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests, stated that the government has allocated Rs. 2 crore for habitat improvement and community-based conservation programs. These programs aim to empower local communities and foster their participation in wildlife protection.
normalised: New initiatives involve the deployment of advanced monitoring technology, including camera traps and drone surveillance, covering an additional five hundred square kilometer of critical habitat. Doctor Anjali Sharma, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests, stated that the government has allocated rupee two crore for habitat improvement and community-based conservation programs. These programs aim to empower local communities and foster their participation in wildlife protection.

unnormalised: Inspired by films like "Sherni", the department is also working on raising public awareness about the importance of preserving India's rich biodiversity. This initiative involves workshops and educational campaigns targeting schools and villages bordering protected areas, particularly focusing on elephant corridors and mitigating human-animal conflict. The measures also include improved veterinary support for injured animals and strengthening anti-poaching squads.
